text: In Etruscan mythology, Ani is god of the sky. He is shown as living in the highest heaven. He is sometimes shown with two faces, possibly showing a link with the Akkadian god Anu and the Roman god Janus.Jordan Encyclopedia of Gods p. 18 ==Notes== == References == * Jordan, Michael Encyclopedia of Gods: Over 2,500 Deities of the World New York: Facts on File 1993 * Fischer, Richard James Historical Genesis: from Adam to Abraham University Press of America, 2007 Category:Etruscan gods and goddesses
title: Ani (god)
